wikipedia_page.main: Ray Ternent (born 9 September 1948) is an English-born former football defender, who played in the Football League in the 1960s and 1970s.He was spotted by scout Jack Hixon in his native north-east and Ternent joined Burnley from school in April 1964 and made his first team debut against Southampton on 8 April 1967.However, Ternent only managed 13 league appearances for Burnley before moving to Southend United in June 1971, where he was part of the 1971-72 team who were promoted from Division Four. After two seasons he moved back north with Doncaster Rovers and also made over 80 league appearances for them before moving into non-league football with Frickley Athletic.Despite being at Burnley at the same time as Stan Ternent, Stan and Ray were not brothers, contrary to some reports.
